title: Deploy the suite on GCP
content:
This section provides information required to install and configure the suite on GCP, including the preparation, installation, and setup tasks.

In addition to the Suite capability, you can also install and enable the following add-on capabilities. For each new installation, the Suite capability is mandatory, and the rest are optional.

Product capability Description
Service Manager Portal Service (SMPS) Services required to integrate an external Service Manager system with Service Portal.
Software Asset Management (SAM) With the hardware and software data discovered by UD and license data retrieved from Service Management, the new SAM capability enables you to calculate and analyze license compliance for the software applications that you are using in your organization. This will reduce the risk of noncompliance and improve the visibility into your financial and operational decisions.

To install these add-on capabilities, use one of the following methods.

  • select the add-on capabilities from the installation portal during the suite installation (see step 2 in the Install the suite section).
  • install the add-on capabilities on top of an existing suite instance (see the Install add-on capabilities section).

Before you begin, ensure that you have the deployment architecture planned.

The following table provides a list of tasks that you must complete in the given order. A user can have multiple roles.

Prepare

Complete these preparation tasks before installing the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1 Prepare a valid Docker Hub account to download the product images from Docker Hub. Any client that has Internet connectivity Any Activate Docker Hub account
2

Prepare GCP project and grant involved accounts with the required permissions.

 GCP Console Cloud administrator Prepare GCP project and roles
3

Prepare a Virtual Private Cloud where you will place all the other resources.

 GCP Console IT / Network administrator Create Virtual Private Cloud
4

Create a new GKE cluster to install OMT and the suite on GCP.

 GCP Console IT / Kubernetes Cluster administrator Build Kubernetes cluster
5

Create and configure a bastion node to communicate with the GKE cluster for the suite installation and troubleshooting.

 GCP Console and bastion node IT / Server administrator and IT / Network administrator Configure bastion node
6 Prepare  Filestore and Persistent Disk storage services for storing OMT and suite data on GCP. GCP Console and bastion node Storage administrator Subscribe to Filestore and Persistent Disk
7 Prepare external PostgreSQL databases. GCP Console and bastion node  Database administrator

Prepare databases
8 Download and extract OMT and suite packages. Bastion node  Suite administrator Download installation packages
9 Download the suite images and transfer them to a registry. Bastion node Suite administrator Upload images to a registry
10

Create namespaces for the suite.

 Bastion node Suite administrator Create namespaces for the suite
11

Prepare persistent volumes for ESM.

 NFS server Storage administrator Prepare persistent volumes for ESM

Install the suite

Complete these tasks to install the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1 Perform pre-installation checks. Bastion node  Suite administrator Perform pre-installation checks
2

Create the deployment file.

Note: This is a prerequisite for step 3a - installing the suite using the CLI.

 Bastion node Suite administrator Create my-values.yaml
3a

Perform this step if you choose to Install the suite using CLI. Skip to step 3b for installing via AppHub.

 Bastion node Suite administrator

Install ESM using CLI
3b Perform this step if you choose to install the suite using AppHub. AppHub Installation portal Suite administrator Install ESM using AppHub
4a Configure an external load balancer to allow external clients to access the Suite services. GCP console Suite administrator Configure an external load balancer
4b
Optional:
If you have installed and enabled one or more Suite capabilities, you can configure internal load balancers for ESM integration if needed.
 GCP console Suite administrator Configure an internal load balancer
5 Verify the installation. Bastion node Suite administrator Verify ESM installation
6 Perform database-related and tuning tasks after installation. Database server and bastion node Database administrator and suite administrator Post-installation tasks

Set up tenants

After installing the suite, perform the following initial setup tasks to use the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Tasks for suite administrators to perform in Suite Administration.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator Tenant setup tasks for suite administrators
2

Tasks for tenant administrators to perform in Service Management.

 Service Management Tenant administrators Tenant setup tasks for tenant administrators

Install add-on capabilities

Skip this section if you don't want to install add-on capabilities or if you've installed them during the suite installation.

Install add-on capabilities on top of an existing suite if you didn't select them from the installation portal when deploying the suite. 

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Install the SMPS and SAM capabilities on top of an existing suite.

 OMT management portal Suite administrator Install add-on capabilities

Configure add-on capabilities

Skip this section if you don't want to install add-on capabilities.

Configure and enable add-on capabilities if you've installed them during or after the suite installation.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Enable the SAM capability.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable SAM
